text: Celil Oker (1952 – 5 May 2019) was a Turkish novelist. He is best known for writing crime fiction. His books include Çıplak Ceset (1999), Kramponlu Ceset (1999), Bin Lotluk Ceset (2000), Rol Çalan Ceset (2001), Bir Şapka Bir Tabanca (2005), Beyaz Eldiven Sarı Zarf (2011) and Sen Ölürsün Ben Yaşarım (2015). Outside of Turkey, his books were published in Europe. He was also a member of staff at Istanbul Bilgi University. He was born in Kayseri. Oker died in Istanbul on 5 May 2019, at the age of 67. ==References== Category:1952 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Turkish academics Category:Turkish novelists
